echo.message: ant build file for MOVES
Available targets:
clean - delete previously built .class files
compile - compile changed Java classes
compileall - compile all Java classes
go - compile all Go code for all configurations (64-bit, 32-bit, Linux)
go32 - compile all Go code for 32-bit architecture
go32local - compile all Go code using the Go compiler at ${user.dir}\go32.
Expect errors if you do not have a Go compiler installed here.
go64 - compile all Go code for 64-bit architecture
compilejavago - compile all Java classes and Go (64-bit) code
docs - generate Java docs
algorithms - generate algorithm HTML file (DEPRECATED)
all - compile java and go, generate docs, and run alltests (DEPRECATED)
alltests - all tests (DEPRECATED)
cleantests - delete all previously built test results (DEPRECATED)
guitests - all GUI unit tests in testdata/abbot/production (DEPRECATED)
inprogressguitests - all GUI unit tests in testdata/abbot/inprogress (DEPRECATED)
508tests - run Section 508 tests (DEPRECATED)
costello - run the Costello tool for building GUI test scripts (DEPRECATED)
recenttests - recent tests, as set by development (DEPRECATED)
testcleanup - delete intermediate files generated during tests (DEPRECATED)
slowqueries - analyze MySQL slow queries (DEPRECATED)
errormessages- generate error message RTF file (DEPRECATED)
startmysql - start a local copy of MySQL (DEPRECATED)
stopmysql - stop the local copy of MySQL (DEPRECATED)
rungui - display the MOVES Master user interface
runworker - display the MOVES Worker user interface
crungui - compile and run the MOVES Master user interface
crunworker - compile and run the MOVES Worker user interface
1worker - start 1 local worker using the manyworkers.txt configuration
file. If running on the same computer as MOVES Master, this
should be run in a separate command window. The worker will
shutdown after there have been no TODO or InProgress files
present for 2 minutes. Before using, edit manyworkers.txt to use
your system's sharedDistributedFolderPath.
Use -Dnoshutdown=1 to prevent the worker from shutting down when
work is no longer available. This can be useful for runs where
MOVES takes more than 2 minutes to produce TODO files. In this
case, when the worker processes are no longer needed, they can
be manually shut down by pressing Ctrl+C at the prompt.
ant 1worker -Dnoshutdown=1
2workers - like 1worker but with 2 concurrent workers
ant 2workers -Dnoshutdown=1
3workers - like 1worker but with 3 concurrent workers
ant 3workers -Dnoshutdown=1
manyworkers - like 1worker but with a user defined number of workers.
Use -Dmaxworkers=N to be set where N is the desired number of
workers to be started. Note: Using more than 3 workers is
unlikely to measurably improve performance.
ant manyworkers -Dmaxworkers=N
maketodo - start MOVES to only generate TODO files without picking up DONE
files or deleting TODO, DONE, or InProgress files upon exiting.
Use -Drunspec= to name the one runspec that will be used. Before
using, edit maketodo.txt to use your system's
sharedDistributedFolderPath.
ant maketodo -Drunspec=c:\myrunspecs\runspec1.mrs
master1worker -start MOVES with a single worker and wait for its DONE files.
Like maketodo, use -Drunspec= to specify the runspec. Before
using, edit both maketodo.txt and manyworkers.txt for your
system's master and worker path settings.
ant master1worker -Drunspec=c:\myrunspecs\runspec1.mrs
pickup - start MOVES to only pickup DONE files. Use -Dpdspec= to name the
PDSpec XML file that will be used. Before using, edit
maketodo.txt to use your system's sharedDistributedFolderPath.
ant pickup -Dpdspec=c:\myinfo\filestoget.xml
makejre - creates a Java Runtime Environment in .\jre that only contains
the Java components used by MOVES.
makeamazon - create amazon/movesamazon.jar utilities
jarcode - create a jar of the code for use with Amazon. Use -Dbuild= to
to specify the build date. The resulting file name will be
yyyymmdd_code.jar
ant jarcode -Dbuild=yyyymmdd
setlogin - store database user and password if the defaults have changed
ant setlogin -Duser=moves -Dpassword=secret
convert2014_3 - convert a MOVES2014 database for use with MOVES3. Specify
the name of the starting database with -Dinput= and name the
resulting database with -Doutput= argument. IMPORTANT: see
database\ConversionScripts\InputDatabaseConverstionHelp.pdf
ant convert2014_3 -Dinput=m2014_in -Doutput=m3_in
convert2014ab_3 - convert a MOVES2014a/b database for use with MOVES3. Specify
the name of the starting database with -Dinput= and name the
resulting database with -Doutput= argument. IMPORTANT: see
database\ConversionScripts\InputDatabaseConverstionHelp.pdf
ant convert2014ab_3 -Dinput=m2014b_in -Doutput=m3_in
dbimporter - run the MOVES Data Importers. IMPORTANT: Generate XML
file from the Tools tab of the County or Project Data
Manager, and then edit as needed.
ant dbimporter -Dimport=c:\mydbimporter.xml
onroadNEIQA - run the onroad NEI QA scripts against one or more input
databases. Use -Dinput= argument to provide the name of the
database. If providing more than one database, either comma
separate the names and quote the whole argument, or list the
database names one per line in a text file and supply the path
to this file in -Dinput. Use -Doutput= to specify the output
file path; file types can be .xls(x), .txt, or .csv. For help,
see database\NEIQA\NEIQAInstructions.pdf
ant onroadNEIQA -Dinput="cXXXXXyYYYY_in,cZZZZZyYYYY_in" -Doutput=PSC_QA_Report.xlsx
ant onroadNEIQA -Dinput=db_list.txt -Doutput=PSC_QA_Report.xlsx
nonroadNEIQA - run the nonroad NEI QA scripts. Usage has the same arguments
as the onroadNEIQA command.
run - Execute a runspec.
Use -Drunspec= to name the one runspec that will be used.
ant run -Drunspec=c:\myrunspecs\runspec1.mrs
Building the 64-bit version of the Go calculator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 64-bit version of the Go generator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go calculator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go generator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go calculator with the local \go32 compiler. Expect errors if no \go32 directory exists.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go generators with the local \go32 compiler. Expect errors if no \go32 directory exists.
Building the default 32/64 version of the Go calculator for Linux with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the default 32/64 version of the Go calculator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 64-bit version of the Go calculator with the system-wide Go compiler. Expect errors if on a 32-bit system.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go calculator with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go calculator with the local \go32 compiler. Expect errors if no \go32 directory exists.
Building the default 32/64 version of the Go generators for Linux with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the default 32/64 version of the Go generators with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 64-bit version of the Go generators with the system-wide Go compiler. Expect errors if on a 32-bit system.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go generators with the system-wide Go compiler.
Building the 32-bit version of the Go generators with the local \go32 compiler. Expect errors if no \go32 directory exists.

then.echo: MySQL is already running and will not be automatically shutdown by this instance.

else.echo: Starting mysqld...
Confirmed MySQL started because its socket has been found.

then.echo: Stopping mysqld via the mysqladmin tool...
Workers and mysql have been shutdown.

else.echo: Workers have been shutdown, but not MySQL since it was already running.

then.echo: MySQL is already running.

else.echo: Starting mysqld...
Confirmed MySQL started because its socket has been found.

target.name: stopmysql
target.echo: Stopping mysqld via the mysqladmin tool...

then.echo: MySQL is already running and will not be automatically shutdown by this instance.

else.echo: Starting mysqld...
Confirmed MySQL started because its socket has been found.

then.echo: Launching the master...
Master finished.
Stopping mysqld via the mysqladmin tool...
Master and mysql have been shutdown.

else.echo: Master has been shutdown, but not MySQL since it was already running.
ERROR: A runspec was not provided. Use -Drunspec=somefile.mrs

then.echo: MySQL is already running and will not be automatically shutdown by this instance.

else.echo: Starting mysqld...
Confirmed MySQL started because its socket has been found.

then.echo: Launching the master, which will launch a worker...
Master and 1 worker finished.
Stopping mysqld via the mysqladmin tool...
Master and mysql have been shutdown.

else.echo: Master has been shutdown, but not MySQL since it was already running.
ERROR: A runspec was not provided. Use -Drunspec=somefile.mrs

then.echo: MySQL is already running and will not be automatically shutdown by this instance.

else.echo: Starting mysqld...
Confirmed MySQL started because its socket has been found.

then.echo: Launching the master...
Master finished.
Stopping mysqld via the mysqladmin tool...
Master and mysql have been shutdown.

else.echo: Master has been shutdown, but not MySQL since it was already running.
ERROR: A pdspec was not provided. Use -Dpdspec=somefile.xml

then.echo: ERROR: The -Dinput= argument was not provided. Type ANT for more information.
ERROR: The -Doutput= argument was not provided. Type ANT for more information.
ERROR: The -Dinput= argument was not provided. Type ANT for more information.
ERROR: The -Doutput= argument was not provided. Type ANT for more information.
Running jlink
Running jlink

else.echo: makejre only works with Java 9 and later
ERROR: A XML importer file was not provided. Use -Dimport=somefile.xml
ERROR: A runspec was not provided. Use -Drunspec=somefile.mrs
